website_summaries.verdict: A decent system loaded with the usual office phone functions as well as an easy-to-use dialing pad and a comfortable receiver. A good alternative to the AT&T system.
pros: Installation is extremely easy and straightforward
VTech is a respected brand in the consumer electronics space
cons: The voicemail system has some glitches which can be frustrating until you get used to them

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could send it back.
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this 0 stars I would. There is a problem with the firmware--the daytime and nighttime auto attendant messages randomly swap. vTech is aware of it but hasn't issued a fix and doesn't have an ETA for it. You're buying a broken product in which all of the advertised features do not work. Also be aware that your announcement messages will be deleted any time the battery is removed and power goes out.
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I am giving this a second star is for the clarity of the headset. If you are looking to use this for outbound calling...DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. This item was purchased to go with the VTech 4 line Business Phone System. It does a great job of receiving calls. The problem occurs when you need to make an outbound call. You have to select a line on the base - dial the number - then once the call is in place, if you want to be hands free you have to transfer the call to the Headset. NOT very customer friendly when you run a business. Feel like I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: David Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: This system has a lot of great bells and whistles you would normally only find in ...
customer_reviews.text: Has helped eliminate automated sales calls. This system has a lot of great bells and whistles you would normally only find in an expensive answering service or software.
customer_reviews.author: Deena Davis

customer_reviews.title: So much better.
customer_reviews.text: Finally after going through one of these a year due to a plastic clip breaking they have a new design. So much better.
customer_reviews.author: cjmesk

customer_reviews.title: Great Call Quality And Range
customer_reviews.text: This headset works great. The call quality is great and it comes with a couple of different options for wearing it...i.e., earbuds (in-ear) or over the ear with a "band" that attaches over the head (over the ear). Personally, I use it with the band that attaches over the head and the earphone sits gently on my ear. You can adjust it so you can wear the headset on either ear. It also comes with a mute button, volume control and an answer button. I use this the most with my VTech business phone system so I can type while talking or pace while talking. I can walk far without any disruption in call quality (so far about 50 feet).
customer_reviews.author: Just Someone

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement headset for the original that came with the V-Tech phones. That one broke almost immediately and I used it with duct tape all around until not even that held it together. After reading the reviews on this one, I decided to give it a try. So far it is holding up well, and doesn't seem to be a flimsy as the original. I will post again if this one fails as quickly as the original. So far so good! :-) It was easy to pair it with the phone, and it fits nicely in its little charging cradle. I recommend this headset.
customer_reviews.author: Spellbound

customer_reviews.title: ONE LINE FINE..
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this item. After 6 months I'm ready to ditch it, here's why: 1.Directory will no longer allows input of both name and number, it only accepts number; 2.Memory call history does NOT store both name/number and time of call... just a name or #... no time 3.If you have a large number of calls in history, you can't view them... you need to start at beginning...see #2 4. If you end a call and immediately punch in another line, the prior line remains on hold and does not disconnect until you place new call on hold and punch up original lane and physically hang up prior line. ONE LINE FINE... MULTIPLE LINES SUCK VERY BAD EXPERIENCE !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Very Unhappy Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much more than I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a four-line phone that I could expand with a cordless. I went with this one based on price and was shocked at the features packed into this. I should note that I work in telecom with huge multi-site enterprise IP-based PBXs so I was expecting a basic four-line phone. What I got was a key-system complete with extension dialing internally, paging, intercom, auto-attendant, etc. The speakerphone quality is above average as well. Perhaps the greatest thing about this system is that you don't need wiring everywhere. Plug the main phone into the four POTS lines and all of your extension phones are wireless.
customer_reviews.author: ACW

customer_reviews.title: Great options disappointing sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: I own a small business. I bought this phone for the auto attendant feature to help mitigate the amount of phone calls we get from people who are asking the same questions. The auto attendant feature “works” but the audio capture sound quality for the auto-announcement is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Eden K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small business telephone system
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I run a business from my home and this system is just excellent. You can add a Vtech head set that is managed through the base unit. It requires a little practice to lean how to transfer incoming call to the headset and to conference calls. It also has internal hold music and you can also use your own music if you prefer. This unit get a five star rating. Sold unit and really inexpensive for the quality and functions it offers. You just need to learn how to use all the functions.
customer_reviews.author: CJPINAJIAN

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I have a feeling this item was a reject that was bought by a third party seller and listed here on Amazon. When I use the headset, I can hear the person I am talking with. The issue is they can not hear me clearly. My voice comes through garbled and with a lot of static. In other words, they can't understand me. THIS IS A BIG PROBLEM! It makes the headset useless. Word to the wise: if you order this item, be sure to test it immediately for its usefulness as I should have done.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Registration instructions unclear BUT works great once registered!
customer_reviews.text: I have a TL86109 Base and the instructions for registering the IS600 headset was not even on the manual. After doing some research online, i found this. Registered in under a minute. Works great so far.. ------------------ Step 1: Remove the headset from the headset base or charger. Step 2: Press and hold HOLD on the telephone base for about four seconds until it shows Registering...Please wait. Then, release the button. Step 3: Place the headset back to the headset base or charger Step 4: It takes up to 60 seconds to complete the registration. When the registration completes, the telephone base displays HEADSET Registered and you hear a confirmation tone.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Office staff love them! New extensions without running more cables!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for a 3-person office. I can't speak from my experience as I haven't used them, but the manager herself gave them "5 stars!" They love finally having nice phones that have all 4 lines on them, extensions, and voicemail! I chose these because the desks are in an open setting and running new lines wasn't practical. This allowed me to give true desk phones to each of the workstations without having to run new lines. It was easy from an installation standpoint, and the employees also love them.
customer_reviews.author: Ed T.

customer_reviews.title: Hand free, Tethered free!
customer_reviews.text: Had this head set for several months. My first one broke, had to replace it to my system I already own. It bloodthirsty toothed up fine, no problems. I only wish the head band where it meets the ear piece was a bit better quality, But if ones careful adjusting it to you mouth with each use, it should last. I use this because of medical reasons. I can not hold a regular phone to my ears for longer then 3 minutes, as my arms go numb. So this is a must, plus love not being tethered to a phone, I can walk around my house, do dishes, and still carry on my conversation.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I hope all newer VTech phone sets ...
customer_reviews.text: This headset delivers a lot more clear sound both for my voice to the person at the other end, and for me to hear the person at the other end comparing to the IS6100 headset came with the VTech wireless phone set.Great product. I hope all newer VTech phone sets are bundled with this headset instead of IS6100.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent C.

customer_reviews.title: Pairing took 20 seconds. Using it is easy.
customer_reviews.text: i have a AT&T CL84102. Pairing it was a simple matter of plugging the headset in, pressing the handset locator button on the base phone, and waiting. Easy. To dial out just dial using the keypad on the phone. Once you hear the ringing press the button on the headset. Then hang up the phone to continue the call. To answer a call just press the button on the headset. The only thing I don't like is the attachments for the headset itself, if you twist them at all the wrong way they will fall off. They are easy to re-attach, but still.
customer_reviews.author: David Hinman

customer_reviews.title: Static!
customer_reviews.text: The call quality gradually dropped over the first month of use until the static popping in the background became unbearable. Luckily I have the deskset as well that I can use until I find a company that is willing to stand behind their product. Tried calling VTECH several times to no avail. I wouldn't recommend even taking a risk with this company if they refuse to send a new product to replace their failing one.
customer_reviews.author: Tylersmithawake

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone System!
customer_reviews.text: Had these deployed for 3 offices now. The main console is easy to setup, and instructions are pretty straight forward as long as you use the quick start guide. I haven't any issues thus far. The included features make it's all worth the money. It even has an aux jack to add music. Adding the Desktop extensions was painless. Takes about few presses and within 30 seconds, it's added into the setup. The only feature I wish it had would be a phone extension port to add perhaps a fax machine, etc.
customer_reviews.author: E.M.

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for occasional Zoom/Team meetings
customer_reviews.text: Works great with the Vtech phone, easy to pair. The sound is OK, say a 5 - 6 on a scale of 1 - 10 but, for the price, it is probably unreasonable to expect a 8 or 9. Charges fast - battery is good for about four hours on active use. You'll have to use the headset option as the ear mountings don't stay on the ear very well. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: William Kelley

customer_reviews.title: No Ear Clip Replacement Available.
customer_reviews.text: Ear clip snapped and no way to buy a replacement from V-Tech or 3rd party. Rendered a $40 headset useless for a 5c piece of plastic. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Herd

customer_reviews.title: this handset cannot be used as an accessory handset!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit to use as an accessory to the extension we already have, however you CAN'T use it as an accessory, you can ONLY use it as an additional line. NOT AT ALL AN ACCESSORY!
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: Main console completely died in less than 30 days of ownership
customer_reviews.text: Main console stopped working, no power running through it, which also takes out all the other handsets and desksets on the system. Horrible situation for a small business to be in, no phones working. Fortunately we kept our old phones and could hook those back up. Vtech support was no help, just told us to return the phones to Amazon as it was in the 30 day return period. Don't think I will ever purchase Vtech for our small business again, just can't risk another product failure.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Great Headset
customer_reviews.text: The headset was easy to setup with my existing Vtech phone base and it's very easy to switch to the headset either to answer calls or to place them. Sound quality is great, it's very convenient for conference calls. Just two slight complaints. When I use the mute button there is a beeping sound about every minute or so which gets annoying and from a comfort perspective the insert for the ear is a little awkwardly shaped. I prefer it to the headband piece but it feels a little strange and pops off sometimes when I take the set off. Still overall a great headset.
customer_reviews.author: Crysthia

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great quality, great features!
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone system! I purchased three pieces, and will be ordering a couple more cordless phones and a couple more corded extensions. This phone works wonderful out of the box! It also has all of the features I want without having to pay the huge prices! For a multi line phone system, you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: reallyrob

customer_reviews.title: Great phone easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: VERY easy to set up. I got one main console and two desk sets. Attached the desk sets to the console was dead easy. Just plug in, push a button on the main, push a button on the remote desk set and in seconds it's working perfectly. No jack, no wiring. The only complication was in attaching the main console, which does have to be plugged into the phone lines, I had to buy a 4-way splitter to split my Cat 5 line into 4 individual line which each plugged into this phone. Bought that through Amazon too. Very happy with operation of the phones so far.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hinton

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality! Easy to install. Only downside was that the instructions were not entirely clear on how to connect existing calls (HINT - you have to use the "Transfer" button and select the headset once the call is already placed). While the headset does allow you to answer incoming calls, it does not allow you to dial out using the headset because you cannot use the dial pad while in headset mode.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L. Herrly

customer_reviews.title: Be absolutely sure that your phone aligns with this device!
customer_reviews.text: Can't wait to use this but unfortunately doesn't work with their brand phone I bought the same day, very disappointed. The advertisement suggested buying one of their several phones in the "other people bought..." So right now useless. Be absolutely sure this device works with your phone before buying. I think they should clear up this situation so others buy compatible phone.
customer_reviews.author: CINDY C. LOWE

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to replace the one that came with my phone. It would no longer charge. Ordered this as a replacement. Obviously it won't fit on the original phone charger, but it works perfectly. Pairing was easy . Battery life is great and sounds great too. Don't hesitate to purchase if you still have a landline phone and want to be able to move around and do things while talking on the phone.
customer_reviews.author: MRMiller

customer_reviews.title: Audio input good, output not great (told I am hard to hear)
customer_reviews.text: Trying to use this for working from home with a new AT&T cordless phone system without headset Jack's on the handsets. Connection to the phone system was easy. Audio is good for listening, but people on the other end complain that it sounds like I am far away in a tunnel and hard to hear. Not a good thing for professional conversations. The mute button is great to have, but a little hard to find/engage when the unit is on your head.
customer_reviews.author: ToddR

customer_reviews.title: Find a different set!
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great phone if the ringer would work all the time. I’ve checked the settings multiple times and everything is set to the loudest setting but for whatever reason the phone will not ring when someone is calling. We ordered one before this and it did the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal S.

customer_reviews.title: Great low cost office system!!
customer_reviews.text: Was using a Panasonic system, but when my last head unit died I can't get them anymore. Found this system and it has been a great replacement. It is better than the Panasonic in my opinion. Tons more features.
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: Clear sound, no mute function
customer_reviews.text: Nice, clear sound. Mostly comfortable ear pieces. NO option to mute which I do not like and is the real reason for the 3 stars. Update - 2 stars now. I bought this to go with my VTECH phone. The phone was junk so I returned it. I tried to return this headset since I wouldn't need it, but they charge a 15% restocking fee and charge you for shipping costs. But they get the product back. Hmmm, nope, I will just keep it. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Echos a lot - sounds like you are calling from a garbage can
customer_reviews.text: Cannot use headset to jump into a call already in progress (or I can't figure it out) Super tempermental with echos. Bought 2 headsets and returning both. Very touchy when dialing out via the base. To make a call, click the big button, then select the line it picked (but don't use speakerphone or you will get feedback) then dial. Half the time it loses the first number of the phone number so you get to start again.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Rambaud

customer_reviews.title: there is nothing like having your hands free if you find yourself chatting ...
customer_reviews.text: Pairs with almost any Vtech phone and a lot of ATT ones also (there's a list on the Vtech website), there is nothing like having your hands free if you find yourself chatting while you go about your dailies. A little clumsy putting it on the charger if you use the headband as we do, it could have been engineered a bit better, but for the price an overall excellent item.
customer_reviews.author: KenFo

customer_reviews.title: good enough for long calls
customer_reviews.text: I got this headset because I have long calls and was tired of having the phone on my shoulder but also when using the speakerphone some people told me that they hear some static. The VTech IS6200 was easy to set up. For those who reported having issues connecting, 1 this is not a bluetooth device, 2 just need to be added (registered) as if it were a new new handset. My only CON is that you still need a handset to use the keys and then transfer the call to the headset.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mondragon

customer_reviews.title: Quick or easy doesn't apply if you have a four line roll ...
customer_reviews.text: Quick or easy doesn't apply if you have a four line roll over system. Even a professional couldn't make it operational or efficient. Its unfortunate we allowed the return threshold to expire before attempting to install the system.
customer_reviews.author: Stoic Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't match my Vtech System!
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't clear that it wouldn't work with my Vtech. And, it didn't. No fault of the headset or the manufacturer. I wish it had, because it would have been wonderful! Thankfully, I bought on Amazon, so, return was a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: bobazon

customer_reviews.title: Love V tech, these headset stink
customer_reviews.text: We use these everyday in the office. They become flimsy or the headset doesn't stay in place within the first 6 months of use. Mailed a couple into v tech they honored the warranty and sent to replacements. One of the replacements pressing the button to answer hardly worked. I loved their old headsets just ordered some of those off E bay. Hoping V tech comes out with a newer one soon.
customer_reviews.author: brody

customer_reviews.title: Buttons randomly stop working; Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this telephone for my home office along with an extension. Without the main console, the extensions don't work at all. A month after purchase, the main unit stopped working. After keeping it unplugged for 2 days, it started to work again. I've had to unplug it for extended periods, over and over, to get it to function. Now, about 6 months after purchase, it has stopped working. Customer service at V-tech is aware of the problem as, apparently, it happens frequently which is perhaps why no returns are allowed after 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: r

customer_reviews.title: 2nd One was a Charm
customer_reviews.text: Everything was intermittent on the first one I got - it was a mess - no quality control. The 2nd one worked perfectly. It works great for hands-free conversations requiring writing and such. It is well worth the money. Only 3 stars because of the first bad one.
customer_reviews.author: Maria K.

customer_reviews.title: Update on how to use the cordless accessory
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to connect to the base phone. The way to use the cordless headset is to dial the number, hit transfer, press 9 and then turn on the headset. When answering the phone, just press the button on the headset. Clear sound and saves a lot of TMJ problems!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Locke

customer_reviews.title: RESET
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone may 28th and it has stopped working is there a reset for this phone it is getting power just no sounds call in or call outs changed cord nope that didn't work unplug then plugged back in that didn't work anything else I might be able to do?
customer_reviews.author: Maria Moore

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the main console and 7 extension units for my new office location. I had concerns that the range would be affected due to concrete block walls between buildings. Set up was very easy and the units look and feel professional. Once all extensions were connected the range was not an issue. Very pleased with this system and would recommend this to upgrade or for new installs.
customer_reviews.author: michael stavola

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive cheaper quality Cordless Phone Headset
customer_reviews.text: This headset unfortunately is the only product available that's compatible with my office Vtech phone system, model# DS 6251-2. A good value for a cheaper quality cordless headset, smaller work area, battery works for about a day, great sound and volume control but uncomfortable to wear longer hours and minimal adjustment options available to help make the ear piece and comfortable. If you work in a larger office space, warehouse the connectivity gets worse and drops calls.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie K  Sonntag Karben

customer_reviews.title: I finally killed my old flakey phone system. Thank you Vtech!
customer_reviews.text: I paid for 6 of these handsets for about the same price I would have had to pay to rewire our office to keep our old phone system! It was essentially free. We set it up in minutes (no tech in our office. It is that easy!) We now have nice music on hold, for which I programed or understood nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Nate the Grate

customer_reviews.title: Paired easily with AT&T CLP99587
customer_reviews.text: Even though the chart on the description doesn’t have this newer model of landline listed, V-tech customer service confirmed it will work, and it did! The volume control doesn’t seem to do anything for me, but it’s fine coz the volume is clear and headset is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an AT&T unit that died after about a week of use. This unit is much lighter and sounds great. It paired easily with the AT&T phone and so far works great. I took off a star because it has limited option for wearing. The one we liked about our old unit was the behind the neck loop, this one doesn't offer that. Otherwise a solid buy so far.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. O. Neal

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly for three lines with no compormises
customer_reviews.text: Replaced two phone systems. All three lines come into the base station with no noticeable distortion. We are able to simultaneously respond to calls on the attached base-station handset as well as any or all of the handsets. A very nice quality machine that works much better than previous two line models from Phillips and RCA.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Haber

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the main console desk set, 2 extension desk sets and 2 hand sets for our church office. Almost purchased them from an office supply store but wasn’t going to be delivered as quickly and was twice the price! Works great, was easy to set up all the phones.
customer_reviews.author: celestesays

customer_reviews.title: Phone puts line on hold automatically
customer_reviews.text: When you pick up the handset to make a call and then select a different line, the phone automatically puts the first line on hold. This is terrible design.
customer_reviews.author: nwh10

customer_reviews.title: the hook for ear is keeping hurting me
customer_reviews.text: I love how this bluetooth earphone makes me able to move around while talking, but it is not comfortable to wear it more than 5 mins. The hook keeps scratching my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Cheng

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon has to sell seconds or "refurbished" stuff because this thing fell apart after a week. 5 uses. Electronics just don't work from Amazon. How can something be that delicate? Even the old fashioned kind held up for a couple months!
customer_reviews.author: Pwitty

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to hook up
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to hook up... very easy to add expansion units. I had to get used to the hold feature because the hold music would start playing when I didn't transfer the calls correctly. But overall very easy unit to install and use. Clear sound... I can't complain!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Koichi Mizushima

customer_reviews.title: Headset option could be better
customer_reviews.text: The main unit works very well, and the overall functionality is great. The default headset that is provided does not work well for answering calls. You have to do a weird multi-step process in order to get the call to be answered on the headset. If that worked as it should this would be a 5-star rating for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Brad J.

customer_reviews.title: Worse phone system ever!!
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the worse phone system ever!! The phone will tie up lines 2 & 3 out of no where and starts beeping, and we don’t even have 3 lines! I’ve tried every thing tech support suggested and it still does it. It’s annoying and a total inconvenience!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good range
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these and have been very happy with them. This one is in a separate building from the base unit, it works perfect and sounds great. The hand held units don't work well at the desk where I wanted to put this so I was a little concerned if it would work. I needn't have been concerned, I am very pleased with the reception.
customer_reviews.author: db

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: The only negative is the lower battery life compared to the previous version. The earpiece has been improved and is less likely to break off like the past version.
customer_reviews.author: C. Todd

customer_reviews.title: So disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for the one I used for several years. When the ear piece broke off the original, I had to replace it. Sadly, this one does not work nearly as well as the original. No matter which ear bud or hanger I use, it will not stay in/on my ear.
customer_reviews.author: teacherrrm

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: works great for me an my older AT&T Cordless phone. I can talk w/family while doing the dishes! Easy one button answer calls and if making a call, dial first on handset, after it starts ringing, just activate the headset. Simple!
customer_reviews.author: THERESA

customer_reviews.title: Sounds echoey and static freequently.
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be a cheaper phone headset. Sometimes picking up the phone there is a very loud static noise. It also sounds echoey when talking on the phone. Unfortunately, we need 4 lines for our business and there are not many options.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this system. It's not perfect, but you get used to way it needs to be handled. Went from the att system to this and so glad I did. Clarity is fantastic. Did not realize the companion phones are all wireless. That is a great feature. No wires to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: 00ducati748

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful phone system for small business
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 desktop, 1 answering machine, and 2 cordless handheld phones for my small business. It was refreshing to be able to set them up quite quickly (unlike my previous AT&T phones). I'm very happy and grateful for these phones!
customer_reviews.author: Tere

customer_reviews.title: SMALL OFFICE PHONE NECESSITY
customer_reviews.text: This is an extension desk phone perfectly matched to the CM-18445 console. Auto attendant is exactly what we needed. PBX systems are expensive and unnecessary with this system. We only have two voice lines but can expand to 4 lines. Currently we only have one extension in our Travel Agency, but can expand the office to accommodate up to 9 more. Looks as good as it operates. STRONGLY SUGGESTED
customer_reviews.author: Ed Scallon

customer_reviews.title: Great value and works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the one that came with my VTech phone. It was easy to set up, replaced the old one with no problem. It has great sound and fits better than the original.
customer_reviews.author: LisaBrashear

customer_reviews.title: Worthless Phone for small business
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE for small business. I run a busy small business and this phone is a nightmare. Also, they are not allowing me to return it. For instance, this phone has 4 line capability, and if you are dialing out and another line rings, it interrupts you dialing out from another line. Also placing people on hold is difficult and 2 people can answer the same line at the same time and conference into the same call in error. Tech support states this is how the phone works. Worthless garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Marcella Mora

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: glad I found this. It was much more than what I paid for on the v-tech site which was strange. I was gifted a v-tech desk phone and needed a secondary cordless for my business. it paired up perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: pchap9800

customer_reviews.title: Speakerphone Echo
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to like this phone because of the enormous recording time but a number of callers complained about an echo noise while on the call. Sure enough, i verified it by having a family member call me on my cell phone while on speaker. Spoke with VTech support and they said it was probably a defective phone and asked me to return it which i did. Ordered another one from Amazon and hoping the next one doesnt have the same issue. Aside from the speakerphone problem, phone appeared to be okay.
customer_reviews.author: NJ

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money for surr
customer_reviews.text: Will keep for convenience at work, but my ear is sore after 4 or so hours. Worth it for the freedom to answer calls while doing other tasks. Love how it snaps right on charger. Also it was very quick and easy to sync up.
customer_reviews.author: Deedee125

customer_reviews.title: Great business phone
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone system. We use 2 of the 4 possible lines. Very easy set up, has intercom and paging. The message system has many options. We have had this system with 3 desk units and one hand held for a year now with NO issues. It also has a great range.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest A.

customer_reviews.title: Does what I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to pair with the phone. Good functionality. Not comfortable for extended use with headband, and the over-the-ear hooks come in several sizes, all of which are not functional for my ear. Still, it does what I needed it to do, which is to allow me to have hands free while I type.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Talbott

customer_reviews.title: Volume
customer_reviews.text: I love the headset itself, it is exactly what I wasn't. However I cannot get the volume high enough for whomever I talk with to hear me. HELP! I want to add That it is hard to turn the head piece on . If it is on my head it takes so long to find the right spot to turn it on the caller would have hung up. please answer with a place that I can reply.
customer_reviews.author: MAE

customer_reviews.title: not very funtional
customer_reviews.text: I really hated that you could not use your phone buttons when you are using the head set. It is essentially a cordless handset without any of the button functions. Don't bother with this product purchase a plantronics it is worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: DKen

customer_reviews.title: Bummer!
customer_reviews.text: It won't let you use the features of the phone and the ones you can use, it is like a lock combo to activate. I feel it was a waste of our money.. so sad, because we really need them and the are very attractive!
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: Great headset
customer_reviews.text: Headset works great. Perfect for landline and range is extraordinary compared to bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Rac C.

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible product. It sounds like everyone is on a barrel and talking in a high pitch. Sounds like this for caller and receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie J.

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure this would work great if you didn't have any other hand sets connected ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this would work great if you didn't have any other hand sets connected to the base. It has to be connected to the base on its own, meaning if you have other handsets you have to de-register all of them and then try to connect this head set. Then de-register the head set, and register all the hand sets again at the end of the day. Too much of a pain in the butt!! Plus we have two lines, so if some one else wants to pick up the other line, they can't because they hand set wont work!
customer_reviews.author: Cmallak

customer_reviews.title: working for many months
customer_reviews.text: Working find and using it since many month. Just the holding on the head could be more stable but other wise very please with the volume and the signal clarity
customer_reviews.author: jacques

customer_reviews.title: I like it, cheaper than a PBX and took longer to open the boxes than setup.
customer_reviews.text: I like it......its less expensive than a PBX system, and the Auto Attendant is a nice feature. My only complaint, is I wish the system would let us program/assign our own extension number. It automatically assigns, based on the number of units registered. Starts from 0 to 9......only (total 10).
customer_reviews.author: MI Intl

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: Love this new phone. Great for my small office. Only issues was that it does not have a data line for a fax machine so had to buy a separate adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Brody

customer_reviews.title: Plugged in and started smoking!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the phone in November for our home office. We did not have a phone line yet as we had moved from ND to UT. We finally got our phone lines in and I plugged the brand new unopened phone and it started SMOKING! now it's too late for me to return or ask for a replacement so I'm stuck with a $100 hunk of burning crap!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: It works good and is easy to connect to the new phone system I just bought.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup and great phone system
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to pair the main console, extension deskset and cordless phone. Did not have to run any additional wires for the extension deskset or cordless phone. Connected the main console to the phone lines and the rest of the setup was quick. Phone lines sound quality is clear. I would recommend this phone system.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great hands free addition
customer_reviews.text: I love a hands free option and this one is great at home! It connected very easily with my phone! I have had it a while now and it seems to be holding up great. I would definitely order it again.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Sue

customer_reviews.title: Single set up.  Great audio quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great add on to our small office system. We can hear everything the caller says, great quality. Works very well. Easy to make compatible - just follow the directions!
customer_reviews.author: K. J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Vtech phones are extremely easy to use and setup for our small office
customer_reviews.text: I currently have 3 corded handsets for our small office. We needed an additional desk with a phone line, so we decided to use a cordless handset. It's so easy to setup and you can have this phone up and running in a matter of 2 - 3 minutes. Sound quality is good and also i can take the handset to the warehouse and still pick up a phone call.
customer_reviews.author: NCSNA INC

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Horrible! Cut out consistently and dropped calls. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Pattylouyse

customer_reviews.title: not great
customer_reviews.text: The phones started saying incoming call randomly and had to be restarted every day or phone calls wouldn't come in. Not great when it blocks your business line and happens when management isn't in.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Outgoing Message Lacks Clarity
customer_reviews.text: The phone itself works well; however, the message clients receive when they call and I’m unable to speak to them, lacks clarity. The outgoing message sounds kind of like I’m talking through static / not to that extent, but still - not clear. Everything else about the phone is good.
customer_reviews.author: Joan H.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, easy pairing
customer_reviews.text: Easily paired with AT&T 83218 phone base. Simply hold down the handset locater button for 2 seconds (while other handsets are in their cradle.) and put the headset in it's charger. It took about 15 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Arnold

customer_reviews.title: It is absolutely useless. It is not that it doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: It is absolutely useless. It is not that it doesn't work, rather that it is a stupid design. You can not answer nor make a call with it without the call being transferred to it. If I have to answer the call first on another device, what do I need this thing for?
customer_reviews.author: mordalo

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Received my phone today, it was so easy to set up and quality looks really good. I do not use but one of the 4 lines, but nice to know I can always add more. Set up all information without needing instructions. I love products like this.
customer_reviews.author: carolminarcik

customer_reviews.title: Easy and worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up to the system at work perfectly. Easy to follow set up from the main phone
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Great 4line
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my small business. 4 lines. Easy to install. Like the fact that the answering machine is included with many functions. I dont have to pay for the answering service.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W.

customer_reviews.title: ADDED TO EXISTING SYSTEM
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent quality wireless phone at a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: B. Brown

customer_reviews.title: I have the Vtech Business phone and this handset is ...
customer_reviews.text: I have the Vtech Business phone and this handset is compatible for it. I could not use it, it will not connect to calls dialing out or received calls. I went through the trouble shooting process, nothing. I am returning it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Verify that this actually works with your model.
customer_reviews.text: Listed our phone as a supported unit, however we have spent nearly two weeks trying to get this to connect without any luck (including support from VTech and AT&T). Hopefully we will find something else that works in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for small offices!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent small office phone system. Easy to use, lots of extra features. No longer have to yell " line one" as you can easily transfer the call to the another desk. Would highly recommend to any small office (up to 9 extensions) - great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The phone arrived and would display "No Power or CS ...
customer_reviews.text: The phone arrived and would display "No Power or CS out of range" rather than the Registration menu upon being initially plugged in. Tech support had me enter *331734# and then press the MENU key and it allowed me to register the phone.
customer_reviews.author: M. Strong

customer_reviews.title: You can hear the other lines in the background when ...
customer_reviews.text: You can hear the other lines in the background when talking on a line, which is quite irritating. I also had one handset go totally fritz and quit working, but I just took the battery out and put it back and no problems since.
customer_reviews.author: Monica M.

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: Ear buds don't stay on. Callers report sound cutting in and out, losing every other word. I suppose you get what you pay for.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: VTech CM18445 Main Console - DECT 6.0 4-Line Expandable Small Business Office Phone with Answering System
product_meta.description: Color:Silver| Style:Main Console"The VTech CM18445 - Main Console DECT 6.0 4-Line Expandable Small Business Phone with Answering System is a new small business system that makes it easier than ever to connect your office. Installation is simple. Only the main console needs to be connected to analog phone lines. The handsets and desksets wirelessly connect to the system with one touch using DECT 6.0 technology, so you can install an entire office system in minutes. No professional assistance required. Plus, the VTech CM18445 - Main Console DECT 6.0 4-Line Expandable Small Business Phone with Answering System allows you to grow into a fully featured telephone system with up to 10 stations. The main console digitally records up to 180 shared minutes of incoming messages, outgoing announcements and memos. The auto attendant for each line can answer outside calls, provide callers with a company directory and route calls to the appropriate extension. Customizable music on hold includes a 2.5mm jack for connecting music devices like MP3 players, boom boxes, tablets or smart phones
feature_bullets: 32 number speed dial and extra-large display for easy viewing
Compatible with anywhere from one to four telephone lines

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars249 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
